intro: Astragalus bombycinus var. elaryshensis, commonly known as the Elaryshen Astragalus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow to orange flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
